tr: written contract or certificate of insurance
example: you should have read the small print on your policy

tr: promise of reimbursement in the case of loss
paid to people or companies so concerned about hazards that they have made prepayments to an insurance company

data.enText: an arrangement with a company in which you pay them regular amounts of money and they agree to pay the costs, for example, if you die or are ill/sick, or if you lose or damage sth

data.chText: 人寿、汽车、旅行平安、家庭财产等保险

data.enText: to take out insurance against fire and theft
insurance premiums (= the regular payments made for insurance)
Can you claim for the loss on your insurance ?
data.chText: 你能向你投保的公司要求赔偿这一损失吗？

data.enText: the business of providing people with insurance
money paid by or to an insurance company
to pay insurance on your house
When her husband died, she received £50 000 in insurance.
data.chText: 她丈夫去世，她得到了一笔5万英镑的保险金。

data.enText: something you do to protect yourself against sth bad happening in the future
data.chText: （防备不测的）保障措施，安全保证

data.enText: At that time people had large families as an insurance against some children dying.
data.chText: 那时人们养的子女很多，以防有孩子夭折。

word_means: 〈体〉保证球队始终处于领先地位的得分
simple_means.memory_skill: in- 在内,进入,使 + sur- 肯定;安全 + -ance 性质,状况

means: （防备不测的）保障措施，安全保证
〈体〉保证球队始终处于领先地位的得分
〈体〉（巩固领先局面）保证最后获胜的

synonyms.bx: 行业术语，只用于人寿保险。

ex.enText: Does she have insurance on her house?

synonyms.bx: 普通用词，可用于一切保险。

example.ex: The insurance company paid out for the stolen jewellery and silver...
example.tran: 保险公司赔付了遭窃的珠宝和银器。

example.ex: We recommend that you take out travel insurance on all holidays.
example.tran: 我们建议您为所有假期都购买旅行保险。

value.def: Insurance is an arrangement in which you pay money to a company, and they pay money to you if something unpleasant happens to you, for example if your property is stolen or damaged, or if you get a serious illness.

example.ex: The country needs a defence capability as insurance against the unexpected.
example.tran: 国家需要有一定的防御能力，以应对不可预知的情况。

value.def: If you do something as insurance against something unpleasant happening, you do it to protect yourself in case the unpleasant thing happens.
